circumstances:
Shortly after take off from Broome Airport, while climbing at a height of some 600 feet, the four engine aircraft was shot down by the pilot of a Japanese fighter and crashed into the Bay of Broome, ten km off shore. On impact, the aircraft broke in two, both wings separated and the fuselage sunk within three minutes. Two passengers (Sgt Donoho and Sgt Beatty) were able to swim to the shore and were rescued. Unfortunately, Sgt Beatty died from his injuries a day later. Thus Sgt Donoho was the only survivor. All passengers were US soldiers joining their base in Indonesia.
